#summary Some of the techniques used in libmv

=== Correspondences ===
==== KLT ====
  * [http://www.ces.clemson.edu/~stb/klt/ The Implementation.]
  * J. Shi and C. Tomasi.  Good Features to Track.  In IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition, pages 593-600, 1994. ([http://www.ces.clemson.edu/~stb/klt/shi-tomasi-good-features-cvpr1994.pdf PDF])

=== Multiview Geometry ===
  * R. I. Hartely and A. Zisserman.  Multiple View Geometry in Computer Vision.  Second Edition.  Cambridge University Press, ISBN: 0521540518, 2004.

==== Focal Length Estimation ====
  * R. I. Hartley.  Extraction of focal lengths from the fundamental matrix.  Technical Repport, 1993 ([http://axiom.anu.edu.au/~hartley/Papers/focal-lengths/focal.pdf PDF])
  * P. Sturm, Z.L. Cheng, P.C.Y. Chen and A.N. Poo.  Focal length calibration from two views: method and analysis of singular cases.  Computer Vision and Image Understanding, Volume 99, Issue 1, July 2005, Pages 58-95 ([http://perception.inrialpes.fr/Publications/2005/SCCP05/SturmZhengChenPoo-cviu05.pdf PDF])
  * H. Stewénius, D. Nistér, F. Kahl and F. Schaffalitzky.  A Minimal Solution for Relative Pose with Unknown Focal Length.  CVPR 2005.  ([http://cmp.felk.cvut.cz/~martid1/articles/Martinec-CVPR2007.pdf PDF])
  * [http://phototour.cs.washington.edu/focal.html Estimating the focal length of a photo from EXIF tags], by Noah Snavely.
  

==== Reconstruction Registration ====
  * D. Martinec and T. Pajdla. Robust Rotation and Translation Estimation in Multiview Reconstruction. CVPR 2007. ([http://cmp.felk.cvut.cz/~martid1/articles/Martinec-CVPR2007.pdf PDF], [http://cmp.felk.cvut.cz/~martid1/demoCVPR07/ web])

=== Dense reconstruction ===
  * C. Zach, M. Sormann, and K. Karner.  High-performance multi-view reconstruction.  In International Symposium on 3D Data Processing, Visualization and Transmission (3DPVT), 2006 ([http://www.icg.tugraz.at/Members/zach/my_publications/3dpvt2006a.pdf PDF])
